title: UFC reinstates Jon Jones
text:
Jon Jones avoids jail time, gets probation October 23, 2015 Updated Oct 23, 2015 at 1:12 PM EDT 
(WBNG Binghamton) Former light heavyweight champion Jon “Bones” Jones has been formally reinstated to the UFC, the organization announced Friday. 
According to the UFC's website, this comes after a review of the plea agreement reached by Jones, officials in Albuquerque, New Mexico, and a judge.

“We've made it clear to Jon that this new opportunity to compete in UFC is a privilege and not a right, and that there are significant expectations we have regarding his conduct moving forward," said UFC Chairman and CEO Lorenzo Fertitta. “We’re happy to read and see reports that he has embraced the terms of his plea agreement and is using this experience to grow and develop as a person.” 
The terms of his plea agreement include mandatory community service, as a condition of his reinstatement. 
The Union-Endicott graduate was suspended from the UFC after an incident on April 26 in Albuquerque, where Jones reportedly ran a red light, struck a pregnant woman's car with the car he was driving, then fled the scene. Jones was set to be indicted for a felony hit-and-run if the case went to a grand jury. He could have faced up to five years in prison if convicted. 
“I am thankful to be able to do what I love once again and I look forward to proving myself as a champion in and outside of the Octagon,” Jones said.
